text:
Social Conditions in Manhattan: In this 2 room apartment at No. 263 Stanton Street, live a father, a mother, two children and a boarder-5 in all. The foreground is the kitchen, living and dining room in the day time which at night becomes a "Pullman car;" two folding cots being stretched out. Undoubtedly published by the New York Evening World of
this date.
November 27, 1923.
Gift of New York World.
N.g.~ 2472
2N ~10
title: Social conditions - [Interior of a two-room apartment.]

folder: Pitt Street & Stanton Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Hamilton Fish Park: An eastward view of the southern portion of same, as viewed from Pitt (foreground) at Stanton (right) Streets. P.S. No. 22, which appears across the Park, is at the N.E. corner of Stanton and Sheriff Streets.

June 26, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Pitt Street & Stanton Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Hamilton Fish Park: The northern half of same, containing the recently constructed (by the W.P.A.) swimming pool. The view is westward to Pitt Street (center background) between Stanton (left) and East Houston (right) Streets. Photographers vantage point is on Willett Street, which divides this open play area into two equal halves.

1936.

W.P.A. Photo.

Federal Writers Project.

Neg # 2977

folder: Pitt Street & Stanton Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Hamilton Fish Park: The new swimming pool and locker building in the westerly half of this recreational space. Technically this is the east side of Pitt Street, north from Stanton to E. Houston Streets.
June 29, 1938.
P.L. Sperr
